result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Exhibits 1-2; Defendant

1:56 PM Defendant Jason M Peterson in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John T. Stichert in court for Jason M Peterson. 
Attorney Stichert starts with the collateral attack motion. Defendant Jason Peterson is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to his personal details. Testifies to being given a transcript and reading through it. Attorney Stichert marks an affidavit as Exhibit #1 and has the defendant review it and testify to his signature being on it. Testifies to nothing changing on the affidavit. Testifies to not knowing any attorneys or being related to any. Attorney Stichert has the defendants previous conviction marked as Exhibit #2 and gives it to the defendant to review. Testifies to not having an attorney represent him before either of the dates on the affidavit and his previous conviction. Testifies to not knowing how much of a disadvantage it was not having an attorney. Attorney Stichert gives the court a document to review. 
Attorney Knaapen cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to previous convictions. Testifies to not having an attorney on the cases, but unsure on a few if he had one or not.
Attorney Stichert questions witness. 
Attorney Knaapen questions the witness. Witness testifies to not thinking an attorney could help him.
Attorney Stichert questions the witness. Testifies to thinking Heinkelman was an Attorney and not against him.
Attorney Knaapen questions the witness. Witness testifies to the transcript given to him. 
Court will have the parties write their arguments and are given 30 days, and then 14 days. 

Attorney Stichert requests to withdraw the motion to suppress fruits of an illegal detention and arrest and court grants and states he can re-file in a timely manner. Attorney Knaapen makes a request. Attorney Stichert gives the court a transcript and reviews the sentences given by the Judge and the defendants response regarding counsel. 
Court is going to find evidence closed at this time. 
Bond is continued. Court receives the Exhibits and admits it into evidence.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of an Illegal Detention and Arrest

records.addlTxt: Notice of Retainer and Entry of Appearance

Adjustment Number: 22A 004570,
Payable Number: 133856,
Amount: $20.00

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jason M Peterson appeared in court. Defendant states he mailed a check to Attorney Stichert to hire him as an attorney. Court will allow the defendant to appear by telephone for the next hearing if Attorney Stichert is representing him. Bond is continued and this matter is reset.
Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Jason M Peterson in court.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This matter is reset to give the defendant time to retain counsel. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Jason M Peterson in court.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Derek Phillippi is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a report of a vehicle being in the ditch. Testifies to his no one being in the vehicle when he arrived on scene. Testifies to driving to locate the male subject. Testifies to stopping a tractor that was neighboring the area and speaking with the two people. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to one of those people in the tractor being the defendant. Testifies to speaking with the defendant and him initialling stating he was heading home. Testifies to the vehicle belonging to the defendant and the keys being in the defendants pocket. Testifies to alcohol being in the vehicle. Testifies to attempting to conduct field sobriety tests but the defendant refused. Testifies to getting a warrant for a blood draw. Testifies to sending the blood in to be tested.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:44 PM Defendant Jason M Peterson in court.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. 22-2149 $2000
Posting Bond Acknowledgment

1:30 PM Defendant Jason M Peterson appears in court, in custody. Attorney Nathan Oswald appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears by video means. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter.
Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.
